programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Boat Jump Swimming with the Fishes Flag Snag" - Contestants must jump between speeding boats, retrieve weights from a tank of rotting squid and climb a flag pole 20 stories up.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Helicopter Fire Drill Eat Rectum Ledge Walk" - Contestants must traverse a cargo net underneath a helicopter, eat pig rectums and walk an obstacle-strewn ledge 11 stories up.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Playmates Super Bowl Special" - Playboy Playmates walk a tightrope 10 stories up, eat strawberries from an insect-filled box and retrieve glow sticks from freezing water.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Blimp Climb Bobbing in Wax Worms Car Flip" - Contestants climb down the side of a blimp, bob for chicken feet in a vat of wax worms and flip a speeding car.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Spiderman Coffin Water Cage (Celebrity Edition)" - Celebrity edition with Stephen Baldwin, Kevin Richardson, Alison Sweeney, Kelly Packard, Alan Thicke and Ali Landry.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Bridge Hang Uterus Skeeball Cable Plate Walk" - Contestants must hang from a bridge, play Skeeball to determine how many pig uteruses they have to eat and walk across a makeshift bridge made out of plates.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Helicopter Climb/Blender of Fear/Pole Hopper (WWF Edition)" - Six WWF stars, Matt Hardy, Jeff Hardy, Test, Mighty Molly, Lita and Jacqueline, compete to win a $50,000 grand prize for charity. Host: Joe Rogan.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Tunnel Swim/Eat Balut/Bike Plank" - Tunnel Swim Contestants would have to swim through an underwater tunnel that was 80 feet long.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Helicopter Jump Tarantula Torture Cell Water Tube" - Helicopter Jump Contestants would be riding in a helicopter as if flew 25 feet above a lake. As the helicopter flew over an island of boxes, they would have to jump out and try to land on the boxes.

programme.title: My New York
programme.desc: Norman rides around his home city of New York while visiting friends, eating pizza with Mario Batali, and exploring the city's art, food, and culture.

programme.title: Bottomless Brunch at Colman's: Volume 4
programme.desc: Join Fear the Walking Dead Star Colman Domingo as he virtually welcomes guests to enjoy a cocktail and a decadent brunch.

programme.title: Start to Finish
programme.desc: After having a few moments of peace, trouble finds its way to Alexandria yet again. Only this time, the threat might be too big to defeat.

programme.title: Talking Dead on "Start to Finish"
programme.desc: Robert Kirkman & Surprise Cast Member discuss the episode, "Start to Finish," from The Walking Dead. Hosted by Chris Hardwick.

programme.title: I Lose People...
programme.desc: The group's hope falters as they seek a way out. Alicia and Charlie reunite with friends.

programme.title: ...I Lose Myself
programme.desc: Morgan struggles to find the strength to help friends in dire need before it's too late.

programme.title: My New York
programme.desc: Norman rides around his home city of New York while visiting friends, eating pizza with Mario Batali, and exploring the city's art, food, and culture.

programme.title: Los Muertos
programme.desc: After the fall of the compound, Madison, Strand, and others forge a tenuous path forward. Meanwhile, Nick is recruited for a perilous assignment.

programme.title: Do Not Disturb
programme.desc: Travis struggles to connect with Chris while searching for shelter. Meanwhile, Alicia meets a lonely woman with a bloody past.

programme.title: Mega Shark vs Giant Octopus
programme.desc: Strange things are afoot in the depths of the sea. First a passenger plane vanishes over the Pacific Ocean. Then an oil platform is obliterated. Marine biologist Emma MacNeil (Deborah Gibson) is dispatched to investigate the phenomena, and, with the help of Japanese scientist Seiji Shimada (Vic Chao), she makes a discovery that will rock the world: An enormous prehistoric shark and a giant octopus have been awakened from their icy slumbers -- and they're hungry.

programme.title: Merlin and the War of the Dragons
programme.desc: Before growing into the legendary adviser to the Pendragons, a youthful Merlin spends his days studying with the Mage (Jürgen Prochnow), a master sorcerer, and honing his magical skills. When a fellow apprentice sorcerer, Hengest (Iago McGuire), grows jealous of Merlin's rapid progress, he rebels against their mutual mentor and betrays King Vortigen (Hefin Wyn) to Saxon invaders. As Hengest conjures an army of dragons, Merlin prepares to test his developing abilities in battle.

programme.title: Hansel and Gretel
programme.desc: In this modern retelling of the classic horror tale, teen siblings are enslaved by a psychotic recluse within her gruesome house of horrors in the woods.

programme.title: Sinbad And The War Of The Furies
programme.desc: On a treasure hunt gone wrong, modern-day adventurer Sinbad accidentally releases the Furies, three beautiful but terrible ancient beings powerful enough to threaten life on Earth.

programme.title: Sinister Squad
programme.desc: When a violent supernatural cult known as Death's Messengers reigns terror on Earth, a team of malevolent storybook villains is coerced into fighting in the modern world, but these baddies must learn to keep their true wickedness at bay if they want any chance at freedom.

programme.title: Titanic II
programme.desc: On the 100th anniversary of the original voyage, a modern luxury liner christened "Titanic II," follows the path of its namesake. But when a tsunami hurls an ice berg into the new ship's path, the passengers and crew must fight to avoid a similar fate.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On Halloween night 2004, Adriane Insogna and Leslie Mazzara were brutally murdered in their Napa, California home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After the suspect was convicted of arson and murder, he maintained his innocence but was sentenced to 25 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman was brutally murdered in her home and the only witnesses to the crime were the family dogs. An expert in canine behavior was convinced the killer knew both the victim and the animals.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl ran and hid when she saw her grandmother being beaten to death, but the man followed, beat and assaulted her. She said the assailant was her uncle, who was convicted.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, the body of college co-ed Laura Salmon was found on a Middle Tennessee farm, covered with her own denim jeans as well as the jeans of the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of an attractive young woman was found a mile from her abandoned car. Police were especially concerned when they realized the victim had come to them for protection just two weeks earlier.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young, attractive hairdresser was sexually assaulted and murdered in her own beauty salon. The evidence at the crime scene didn't match any of the suspects and the case went cold for ten years.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women went missing and were later found brutally murdered, police wondered if they were victims of a hate crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A human skeleton was discovered in the North Carolina marshlands. Investigators learned she'd been dead for 18 months.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In a tragic twist of fate, just days after the woman sold her home and moved to a modest trailer, a fire took both the trailer and her life. But the autopsy proved this was no accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A security guard disappeared from his post without a trace his remains were found a year later in a remote camp site.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college senior was found raped and murdered near an unpaved footpath used by students to walk from one side of campus to the other.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man riding a bicycle was fatally injured, and police believed he was the victim of a hit-and-run accident. Tiny clues found at the scene created a picture of the vehicle which struck him and led police to its driver.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide - but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''A Rough Day on the Runway'' - The designers get a lesson on fashionable politics when they learn about the creation and longevity of American sportswear. Actress January Jones guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Race to the Finish'' - The stakes are raised in all directions when the designers are challenged to create a high fashion look and the winner receives one of the biggest rewards in Project Runway history.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''There's A Pattern Here'' - The designers take a trip down memory lane when old photos of themselves pop up in the workroom. But they are quickly brought back to the present when they are tasked with designing their own fabric and garment to correspond with a memorable time in their lives. One designer reveals an emotional secret that leaves everyone shocked and in tears. Designer Rachel Roy guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''A Look in the Line'' - The designers get an opportunity to create a look for the launch of Heidi Klum's own ready-to-wear line. The remaining designers discover that they need to enlist some help when Heidi throws a curveball at them. Designer Norma Camalli guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''We're in a New York State of Mind'' - The final five designers get treated to a night of luxury in a penthouse suite for all their hard work and making it this far. A prominent NYC figure presents the designers with the final challenge to determine who moves on to Fashion Week.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Finale Part 1'' - Tim Gunn visits the hometowns of the four remaining designers—but only three will show as finalists at Lincoln Center.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Finale Part 2'' - In the conclusion of the finale, one designer is named the winner of Project Runway Season 8.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "A Times Square Anniversary Party" - For the 10th Anniversary of Project Runway, 16 new designers arrive in NYC with big dreams and a homework assignment: bring a garment that best represents their aesthetic. Upon arrival, they learn that for their first challenge they will have to create a companion piece to that look, and they will only have one day before they are presenting on the biggest stage in Project Runway history: the middle of Times Square!

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Welcome Back (or not) to the Runway" - The designers are broken into teams of two, where they are tasked to design a red carpet look to be worn at the Emmys. Each team is assigned a client to design for, and this client is one of several past contestants on Project Runway. Each outfit is also inspired by a different color Lexus, which serves as their mode of transportation in the beginning of this episode.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Jemma'' - An outgoing German Shepherd/Lab mix named Jemma could be the perfect canine ambassador for one woman's bed and breakfast. But before this seven-month-old puppy can assume her new role, she'll need to check her immaturity at the door.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''New Skills'' - For five lucky shelter dogs, a forever home is right around the corner. But before they can step into their new lives, they'll all need to embrace "new skills."

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Darby'' - A middle school teacher reaches out to Brandon in hopes of adopting her very first dog. But if nine-month-old Darby wants to be the teacher's pet, she'll need to ace the common commands and prove she's ready for a classroom environment.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Lola'' - When conventional training methods fail to pull a timid Welsh terrier mix named Lola out of her shell, Brandon recruits another "Lucky Dog in Training" to build Lola's confidence.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Riley'' - Brandon transforms an "untrainable" two-year-old spaniel mix into one of the most talented agility dogs in Lucky Dog history. But will Riley's high-octane energy level prove too much for his potential mom, who suffers from chronic fatigue syndrome.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Maggie'' - A spaniel mix named Maggie could be the perfect companion for a couple that recently lost their beloved golden retriever. But when Maggie's crippling fear of abandonment fails to respond to training, Brandon must turn to an outside source for help.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Friendships'' - They're called "Man's Best Friend", but for these five dogs, companionship defies age, size, gender and even species. Today we look back at some of this year's most heartwarming, and surprising, "friendships".

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''JoJo and Rhi Rhi'' - Brandon rescues JoJo and Rhi Rhi in hopes of placing them in the same home. But preparing them for Josh and Jonathon's jet-setting lifestyle means a lesson in flying the friendly skies and helming a stand-up paddleboard.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Maverick'' - A devoted mother reaches out to Brandon in hopes of finding a support animal for her autistic son. But before Maverick can officially become Dustin's wingman, he'll need to prove he has the temperament and social skills needed for his new role.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Odie'' - A standard poodle named Odie could be the emotional support animal one young woman needs to conquer her severe anxiety. But before Odie can inspire Casey to go back to school, he'll first need to focus on his own graduation.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Scarlett'' - Brandon rescues a two-year-old golden retriever that lives life in the fast lane. But when Scarlett's new family expresses an interest in taking her on road trips, she and Brandon must hit the road for a lesson in car etiquette.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Handing Over the Reigns'' - Brandon prepares six shelter dogs for life after the ranch. But before he "hands over the reins" to their new families, he'll need to ensure that each new owner is ready for the responsibility and challenge of their new pup.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Stewie'' - Brandon adopts a hand shy dachshund mix with a history of prior abuse. But before Stewie can officially settle into his loving new home, he'll need to prove that he can get along with his new brother, an eleven-year-old lab mix named Drogo.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Dottie'' - A last minute rescue gives one senior dog the chance to live out her golden years in an exciting new role. But before Dottie can officially join Kris and his company's mascot Lucky, she'll need to embrace office etiquette and a love for travel.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Otto'' - When a ranch employee takes a leave of absence to recover from an ongoing medical condition, Brandon trains an Australian cattle dog named Otto to be her companion... and her lifesaver.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Best of: Special Connections'' - Being pack animals, dogs possess an instinctual need to bond... but some bonds run deeper than others. To honor "man's best friend", we look back at some of this season's most heartwarming and inspirational connections.

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Detroit Pistons Langston Galloway vs Nike SB Collector in a Sneaker Battle From Home!

programme.title: Qias Omar vs HesKicks In A Sneaker Battle From Home! | #LIFEATCOMPLEX

They both started their respective channels back in 2012, Heskicks vs Qias Omar, is a battle of old school collecting versus new school hype! The two put on a display of versatility for the public in an incredible 5 round battle! Make sure you watch and debate for yourself on who won this battle!

programme.title: Lavar Ball vs Jacques Slade In A Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we managed to put on the most unexpected pairing to date! In one corner, he is an OG to the Sneaker Youtube space, some would consider him the Godfather of sneaker unboxing videos, @Jacques Slade aka Kustoo is here to battle! His opponent is the undefeated one, this man NEVER LOST a single competition of any sort in his life, Lavar Ball is here to battle! Watch the battle and let us know who won this matchup!

programme.title: Watch King Combs Choose Between Drake & Pusha T for Best Rapper of the Decade | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: Complex Brackets is a new game show from Complex News where your favorite celebs choose the best rapper in any one of these four categories: Best East Coast Rapper, Best West Coast Rapper, Best Rapper of the Decade, and Best Rapper of All Time. In this episode, King Combs hits a wall when he has to choose between Drake and Pusha T for the crown of Best Rapper of the Decade. Be sure to check out Complex Brackets every Monday at 2:00pm EST right here on Complex News.

programme.title: Moneybagg Yo Crowns The Best Rapper of the Decade | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: The Dirty South dominates throughout this episode when Moneybagg Yo sticks to his roots as he goes through our Best Rapper of the Decade bracket. The Memphis rapper delivered upset after upset while being faced with tough choices between hip hop giants and rappers who spoke to his life growing up. Make sure you share your choices in the comments below. Would you have picked the same?

programme.title: James Harden Rocks Louis Vuitton and Chris Paul Reps Black-Owned Brands | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On the latest "Tunnel Takedown," hosts Kalysse Anthony, Mouse Jones and Racks Hogan can't agree on Russell Westbrook's latest look and break down why James Harden's Louis Vuitton outfit missed the mark. Then, we shout out Chris Paul for his support of black designers, and Racks explains how to tell the difference between an original vintage t-shirt and a reproduction.

programme.title: Kiana Ledé Explains Her "Chocolate" Video

programme.title: The Perfect New York Slice with Frank Pinello and Michael Imperioli | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: In New York City, pizza isn't just food, it's a way of life. But which iconic NY-style dish reigns supreme: the Sicilian square or the classic round pie? In the series premiere of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Best Pizza's Frank Pinello to find out which slice is the true king of New York. And who better to judge the event than legendary actor and pizza obsessive Michael Imperioli?

programme.title: Binging with Babish Judges Movie-Inspired Pizzas: Nicole Russell vs Mike Greenfield | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Which movie-inspired pizza reigns supreme: the broccoli-topped pie from Inside Out, or "pizza in a cup" from The Jerk? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, Binging with Babish has challenged her and Pro Home Cooks' Mike Greenfield to take his silver-screen recreations to the next level. Will Nicole's Cup O' Pizza earn her a much-needed victory following a tough loss to Frank Pinello in Episode 1?

programme.title: The Ultimate Viral Pizza Showdown with Mike Hauke, Mark Iacono, and Scott Wiener | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Ramen, tacos, cheeseburgers, fried chicken-Mike Hauke of Tony Boloney's can turn just about anything into a pizza. But has the undisputed king of Instagramable pies finally met his match? In a brand new episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell attempts to wrestle the crown from Dr. Franken-slice in a viral pizza showdown for the ages. Will Nicole's popcorn-crusted bar pie be enough to topple Mike's bone-in "Flaming Cowboy"? Only pizza pros Mark Iacono and Scott Wiener can decide.

programme.title: Sean Evans and Farideh Sadeghin Taste Test Chicago Deep Dish Made by Two New Yorkers | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Can two thin-crust loving New Yorkers make deep dish pizza fit for a Chicago native? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza maker she must face off against Josephine Giordano of Lenny's Pizza to see if she can conquer the Windy City's most controversial culinary export. Will Nicole's chicken parm-packed deep dish be enough to the win the favor of Muchies' Farideh Sadeghin and Chicago native Sean Evans?

programme.title: The Perfect Detroit-Style Pizza with Cliff Skighwalker, Adam Richman, and Reina Scully | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Detroit is home to some of America's most delicious pizza. But who can create the ultimate Motor City-inspired slice? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, she must face off against chef Cliff Skighwalker in a good ol' fashioned pan-pizza throwdown.

programme.title: Mythical Chef Josh and Nicole Russell Make Taco Bell and Beef Patty Inspired Pizzas | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Pizza is the ultimate blank canvas for culinary innovation. In this episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Mythical Chef Josh to see who can create the ultimate "mashup pie." At Mythical Kitchen, Josh has perfected the art of fast-food fusion, but will his Doritos Locos Taco Pizza be enough to take down Nicole's Jamaican beef patty-inspired pie? The choice is up to this week's judges: Complex's Speedy Morman and chef Jae Lee of Nowon in NYC.

programme.title: Moneybagg Yo Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex

programme.title: Karol G Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex

programme.title: Michael Strahan Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: NFL Hall of Famer Michael Strahan goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods for the Season 12 finale and talks about getting Air Jordans 1s in 1985, sitting front row at Kanye West's Yeezy Season fashion show, and his viral prank of getting his teeth fixed.

programme.title: Rod Wave Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex

programme.title: Rowdy Rebel Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex

programme.title: G Herbo Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: G Herbo goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about how he used to clean sneakers growing up, camping out for shoes, and why he loves Air Force 1s so much.

programme.title: How to Cook a Double-Dipped Roast Beef Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: The double-dipped roast beef burger is an icon of Brooklyn, New York, and Burger Scholar George Motz is here to teach you how to make one at home. This regional one-off burger-known locally as the "Gargiulo"- hails from the historic roast-beef emporium Brennan & Carr. Here, the burger patty is topped with freshly sliced roast beef, sauteed onions, American cheese, and is eventually dunked in a vat of piping hot beef broth.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Steakhouse Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz usually smashes his patties with childlike glee. But today, he has his eyes set on a different prize: the luxurious, thick, dry-aged steakhouse burger! The beauty of this style is its lack of adornments-a juicy patty, cheese, and a sturdy bun, which all help emphasize the beef. In the words of Motz: "Take the upgrade people!" Without further ado, learn how to cook a perfect steakhouse burger at home!

programme.title: How to Cook a Loose Meat Sandwich with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Here's a weird one for you-the Loose Meat Sandwich from the Midwest. Is it a hamburger? We're not entirely sure. Is it amazing? Hell yes! Think of a Sloppy Joe, minus the slop. If you close your eyes and bite into a loose meat sandwich, you taste all the elements of a hamburger: bun, beef, seasoning, mustard, onion, pickle. And now it's George's job to bring this Midwest icon into your home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Mississippi Slugburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a hyper-regional slugburger from Northern Mississippi. Borne out of the Great Depression, the slugburger patty combines beef and bread crumbs-a method that was used to extend the meat supply. As the bread crumbs toast on the griddle, they absorb the rendered beef fat, creating the ultimate crispy burger. Here is your master class on how to make a regional slugburger at home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Texas-Style Smoked Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz has taught us about fried burgers and steamed burgers, but did you know about the smoked burger from Texas? In this episode, George teaches you how to apply the principles of barbecue to a burger. With a simple offset smoker set-up, you can achieve the perfect smoke ring on this burger right in your own backyard. Here is your master class on the Texas smoked burger.

programme.title: How to Cook a Hawaiian Loco Moco Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is here to set the record straight: A real homegrown Hawaiian burger is NOT a beef patty topped with pineapple and ham. When locals crave a burger, they order something called the loco moco. Technically a 'burger plate,' this regional icon is a burger patty placed on a bed of rice, drenched in gravy, and topped with a fried egg. A popular late-night order at diners, the loco moco is one of George's favorite burgers to eat. And now's your chance to make one at home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Deep-Fried Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In our season finale, Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a regional specialty from Tennessee: The deep-fried burger! At a place called Dyer's in Memphis, burgers are smashed paper thin and dipped in a skillet filled with hot beef tallow-a method that harkens back to the dawn of the original hamburger. Grease is an heirloom at Dyer's. When you bite into a burger from there, you're biting into history. That's because the same grease has been used since 1912!

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Patty Melt with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook his favorite patty melt! Motz says this is the burger he dreams about all the time, and you'll quickly learn why it's so unique. Borrowing a method from Wisconsin burger shacks, Motz poaches the hamburger patty in beef stock and slides it in between a grilled cheese. This is truly regional hamburger nirvana.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Double Cheeseburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook one of the most important hamburgers in America-the original double cheeseburger from Southern California's iconic Bob's Big Boy Restaurant. This is the double burger that birthed all other double burgers (and even predates the invention of the Big Mac by almost 30 years!). Learn how to make a perfect double cheeseburger at home while soaking up some hamburger history.

programme.title: How to Cook 2 Regional Fast-Food Burgers with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is taking you on a ride through regional American fast-food burger history! A lot of the big, commercial fast-food places have given the hamburger a bad wrap. Which is why George wants to set the record straight and show you two family-owned, hyper-regional burger chains that still do it right-Swensons in Ohio, and Fat Mo's in Tennessee. These beloved burgers are highly unique, and take a few twists and turns to get to the finished product.

programme.title: How to Cook a Spicy Malaysian Egg Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In this special episode of Burger Scholar Sessions, George Motz pulls back the curtain on an international street-food icon: the spicy Malaysian egg burger! This burger is so famous that it goes by several names-the Ramly Burger, the Sloppy Burger, and the "Sampah" Burger, which translates to "rubbish" in Malaysia. But this burger isn't rubbish at all it's a total flavor bomb. Wrapped in an egg and covered with spices, it's one of the craziest burgers George has ever tried.

programme.title: An Open Conversation about Kanye West
programme.desc: On this episode Complex staffers, Khal and Jinx, weigh in on Kanye's media takeover, from his interview with Charlamagne Tha God, his appearance on TMZ, and his current state of mind.

programme.title: Kumu Hina
programme.desc: Imagine a world where a little boy can grow up to be the woman of his dreams, and a young girl can rise to become a leader among men. Welcome to Kumu Hina's Hawai'i. Kumu Hina tells the inspiring story of Hina Wong-Kalu, a transgender native Hawaiian teacher, or kumu, who brings to life Hawai'i's traditional embrace of mahu - those who embody both male and female spirit. Produced by Emmy-winning directors Dean Hamer and Joe Wilson in association with ITVS and Pacifc Islanders in Communications, the film traces Hina's evolution from Collin Wong, a timid high school boy, to her present position as a married woman and cultural director of a school in one of Honolulu's grittier neighborhoods. When Ho'onani, a charismatic 6th grade girl, asks to join the school's all-male hula troupe, Kumu Hina gives her the opportunity to express her inner male spirit. As teacher and student prepare for a climactic end-of-year public performance, they meet many obstacles, but hold fast to the idea that being true to oneself matters most.

programme.title: Greetings From Fire Island
programme.desc: Greetings from Fire Island is a documentary that captures the natural beauty and history of a long wisp of land off the coast of Long Island's south shore.

programme.title: Gay USA
programme.desc: In June 1977, Director Arthur J. Bressan, Jr. mobilized camera crews across the country to document National Gay Freedom Day marches. Gay USA conveys the passion, anger, and defiant optimism of a community under attack, and illustrates the triumphant power of love and pride. Beautifully restored in 2K by the UCLA Film & Television Archive in collaboration with Frameline and Outfest.

programme.title: Political Animals
programme.desc: Political Animals celebrates the legendary civil rights victories of four trailblazing California state politicians: Carole Migden, Sheila Keuhl, Jackie Goldberg, and Christine Kehoe. Fierce and unrelenting, these courageous women toppled a partisan majority and emerged victors to pass historic legislation for social justice and LGBT+ equality. It was a hard fight - filled with vehemently heated debates and hateful insults hurled by opponents. Today, the message behind Political Animals is more important than ever as the current political theatre unfurls around the globe. These inspiring biographies further reveal the critical importance for public resistance at the local level to pressure lawmakers to enact difficult change. Political Animals is a clear call to action for a new era of greater democratic participation. We invite you to follow in the footsteps of these historic leaders and become the next pioneering political animal!

programme.title: The QueerX Awards
programme.desc: The circus is in town and just in time for National Coming Out Day! Welcome to the 2021 QueerX Awards brought to you by Lexus. Join us as hosts, Drew Droege and Raneir Pollard, take us on a carnival tour of LGBTQ music, films, and icons! Featuring appearances by Bowen Yang, Michaela Jaé Rodriguez, Patton Oswalt, Dwyane Wade, Erica Wheeler, and Elvira, Mistress of the Dark, Cassandra Peterson. And don't miss the special performances by Chanel and the Circus, Mila Jam, and Alsace Carcione.

programme.title: 2 In The Bush: A Love Story
programme.desc: Emily has just been dumped by her girlfriend, kicked out of her apartment, and fired from her job. Her best friend hooks her up with a new gig: personal assistant to a dominatrix. But when Emily falls for her new boss -- and her new boss's boyfriend -- she must decide what risks are worth taking for love. 2 In The Bush is an unconventional romantic comedy about dungeons, a fish named Archimedes, and the many forms that love takes.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: The aim of the game is to complete five challenges without losing all their lives. Challenges tonight include Cream Fling and Yum Yum Rum.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Life really doesn't get much more fabulous than watching 20 hopeful - and sometimes hopeless - ordinary British folk fly halfway across the world to test their skill, endurance, nerve and bouncability on the incredible Total Wipeout course in Argentina. There is a cash prize waiting for the winner, plus a shiny trophy, a lifetime of amusing anecdotes, and a nickname from host Richard Hammond.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Total Wipeout, the biggest, brashest and most exhausting game show on television, is back for more bangs, bumps, and bruises. This episode sees the return of the finalists from across the series as they compete for the ultimate title, 'Champions of Champions'. They pit themselves against some of the hardest obstacles we've ever witnessed on their journey to get to the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond dons his tuxedo for a special program honoring the heroes of Total Wipeout's fifth series. The presenter starts with the 'Best new obstacle award' and will be showing the top five, and the winner for each category. Don't miss out on this special episode because surely, it will make you have good laughs!

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Challenges this time include Candle Scream, Dizzy Hurdle and the all-new Shock Roulette.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

Contestants take on four hard and tough games with the western films' sound effects and the accompaniment of Amanda Byram and Richard Hammond. They also welcome back favourites from the previous four series such as Man Mountain Syed, Rock God John and Total Wipeout's most famous couple 'Charlardo'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: IMPACT! Wrestling - October 4, 2019
programme.desc: IMPACT! emanates from Las Vegas, as Sami Callihan must face the repercussions of his actions last week when he struck Melissa Santos during her wedding reception and first dance with IMPACT World Champion Brian Cage. âUnbreakableâ Michael Elgin goes one-on-one with TJP, who will have Fallah Bahh in his corner. Weâll get a glimpse into the future, as top prospects Daga and Chris Bey face off in a qualifying match to determine who will go to Bound For Glory to compete in the X-Division ladder match. Tenille Dashwood looks to continue to build momentum as she prepares for her Knockouts Championship match with Taya Valkyrie at Bound For Glory when she battles Kiera Hogan and Madison Rayne in a 3 Way Knockouts clash. Johnny Swinger makes his in-ring debut. Plus Ken Shamrock and Moose take part in a press conference to officially announce their upcoming showdown at Bound For Glory.

programme.title: IMPACT! Wrestling - September 13, 2019
programme.desc: On this weekâs action packed edition of IMPACT! from Mexico City, Tommy Dreamer and Tessa Blanchard join forces as they battle Sami Callihan and Jake Crist in a Street Fight. After weeks of trying to seduce Alisha Edwards, Ace Austin will go one-on-one with a vengeful Eddie Edwards. âUnbreakableâ Michael Elgin will be in action as he sets his sights on a special opponent at Bound For Glory. Lucha Libre legend Dr. Wagner Jr. will take on Texano Jr. Kiera Hogan battles Tenille Dashwood in Knockouts action. The Desi Hit Squad take on the team of Big Mama and Nino Hamburguesa. Moose will address his bitter feud with Ken Shamrock. Plus the countdown begins to the wedding of IMPACT World Champion Brian Cage and Melissa Santos in two weeks.

programme.title: IMPACT! Wrestling - September 20, 2019
programme.desc: IMPACT! features the farewell to LAX from Mexico City, as Santana and Ortiz enter an IMPACT Wrestling ring for the final time against the team of Rich Swann and Willie Mack. In an eight-person Street Fight, oVe members Sami Callihan, Madman Fulton, Jake Crist and Dave Crist battle the team of Tessa Blanchard, Tommy Dreamer, Rob Van Dam and Rhino. IMPACT Knockouts Champion Taya Valkyrie takes on Alisha Edwards. Mahabali Shera, the newest member of the Desi Hit Squad, goes one-on-one with Cody Deaner. The Rascalz take on the high-flying trio of Arez, Toxin and Australian Suicide in six-man tag team action. Havok collides with Su Yung in a no disqualification match. The latest addition to the Knockouts division, Tenille Dashwood sits down for an exclusive interview. Plus weâll get a glimpse into the bachelor and bachelorette parties of IMPACT World Champion Brian Cage and Melissa Santos ahead of their wedding next week.

programme.title: IMPACT! Wrestling - September 27, 2019
programme.desc: IMPACT! returns to Las Vegas with the wedding of IMPACT World Champion Brian Cage and Melissa Santos. Qualifying matches get underway for the 5 Way X-Division Championship ladder match at Bound For Glory, as Tessa Blanchard goes one-on-one with Dave Crist. The newest addition to the Desi Hit Squad under the tutelage of the Great Gama Singh, Mahabali Shera takes on Cousin Jake. The Knockouts are in action, as Madison Rayne battles Tenille Dashwood. Plus âThe Worldâs Most Dangerous Manâ Ken Shamrock makes his long awaited return to IMPACT Wrestling, as he plans to address his rivalry with Moose ahead of their upcoming match at Bound For Glory.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 16

Competing in the largest card-room in the world with no reentry option players made sure to bring their A-game. Number one online poker player, Paul Volpe, leads the final table in chips but he’ll have to play strategically with all six of the finalist’s eyes on the coveted WPT Champions Cup. Commentators Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten bring you all the heart pounding action from the Commerce Casino.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 17

Commentators Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten, along with anchor Kimberly Lansing bring you all the twists and turns in the LA Poker Classic.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 18
programme.desc: The third and final installment of WPT’s coverage at the LAPC is wrapping up with excitement and anticipation bursting through the roof. The chip-counts have risen and fallen all across the table leaving no clear favorite to join the ranks of poker legends of past and claim the prestigious title. Jessica Lansing hosts while Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten calls the play at the Commerce Casino.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 19
programme.desc: The unique Bay 101 Shooting Star has returned to play host to a record breaking number of competitors and another star studded field. Players had the opportunity to claim bounties from the top pros’ by busting them making the competition to reach the final table fierce. Though, this wasn’t enough to stop one of top money earners of all time, Erik Seidel, who is joined by two local poker heroes, an internet pro, a cash game expert and back-to-back finalist Paul Volpe who leads the final table in chips a second time in a row. Kimberley Lansing anchors while Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten call the action.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 20
programme.desc: World Poker Tour ignited the global poker boom with a unique television show based on a series of high-stakes tournaments. WPT events turned Gus Hansen into the Great Dane and Daniel Negreanu into Kid Poker, and created dozens of poker-made millionaires.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 21
programme.desc: The battle rages on between the two professionals and the two amateurs causing a complete reversal in the players starting chip stacks. The historically supportive Bay 101 crowd has helped to throw the two local heroes into the chip leading positions and leave much to be desired for the pros, but will their momentum allow one to break through and claim the WPT title? Kimberly Lansing Anchors while Mike Sexton and Vince Van Patten call the play.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 22
programme.desc: WPT’s very own Mike Sexton is sat amongst the finalists this year in Venice to widespread fan and viewer appreciation giving him an awesome opportunity to top off his poker resume with a WPT title. Mike is joined by his Italian counterpart, Erion Islamay, as well as three notable international pros and the chip leading amateur Marcello Montagner. In place of Mike, ‘Poker Brat’ and poker legend, Phil Hellmuth, joins Vince Van Patten in the commentator’s booth for the Grand Prix de Paris

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 23
programme.desc: World Poker Tour ignited the global poker boom with a unique television show based on a series of high-stakes tournaments. WPT events turned Gus Hansen into the Great Dane and Daniel Negreanu into Kid Poker, and created dozens of poker-made millionaires.

programme.title: The World Poker Tour Season 11 Episode 24
programme.desc: A new WPT champion will be crowned at the world’s oldest casino in the final episode of the WPT Venice Grand Prix. Poker Hall of Famer Mike Sexton has managed to reach the final three but he sitting in the 3rd chip position behind two Italians who each look as eager as him to take down the title tonight. One of the most successful poker pros of all time, Phil Helmuth, fills in for Mike in the commentator’s booth alongside resident expert Vince Van Patten for the finale of the Venice Grand Prix.

programme.title: The 3 Best
programme.desc: The top three recipes in every food category.

programme.title: Ultimate Sticky Buns
programme.desc: A sticky bun should be neither dense nor bready, neither saturated with butter nor so sugary that it makes your heart race. The crumb should be tender and feathery and the sticky glaze gently chewy and gooey. Here's how we made ours.

programme.title: Chicken Two Ways
programme.desc: When you eat chicken frequently, it pays to have a number of preparations on hand. In this episode, we turn to orange-flavored chicken and chicken teriyaki.

programme.title: Indian and Thai Curries
programme.desc: In this episode, we prepare an Indian-inspired shrimp curry and a Thai-inspired green curry with chicken.

programme.title: Old-Fashioned Chocolate Cake
programme.desc: Our goals in this episode are twofold: create an old-fashioned chocolate layer cake with the same moist, tender crumb we so fondly remember from our childhoods, and infuse it with true chocolate flavor-chocolaty enough to please adults, but not so dense that it might scare away the kids at the table.

programme.title: Meatloaf Dinner
programme.desc: Meatloaf made with all beef requires some special handling so that it doesn't taste like a dry, loaf-shaped hamburger. We set out to make a loaf with well-seasoned meat and just enough binder to give the loaf a tender, not tough, texture. In choosing a side dish to partner with our meatloaf, we turned to another old-fashioned dish-skillet-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: Roast Beef and Potatoes
programme.desc: Test cook Natalie Estrada reveals the secrets to making a foolproof Classic Roast Beef Tenderloin with host Bridget Lancaster. Next, host Julia Collin Davison discovers equipment expert Adam Ried's top pick of tongs. Finally, test cook Lawman Johnson shows Julia how to make perfect Lyonnaise Potatoes.

programme.title: Comfort Food Done Right
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison and host Bridget Lancaster uncover the secrets to making a flavorful Double-Crust Chicken Pot Pie from scratch. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Julia Collin Davison to a tasting of creamy peanut butter. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore makes Julia a delicious First Lady specialty, Cowboy Cookies.

programme.title: Cast-Iron Comforts
programme.desc: Bridget Lancaster uncovers the power of the cast iron, showing host Julia Collin Davison how to achieve restaurant-worthy homemade pizza, made in a cast iron skillet. Next, Adam Ried reviews his top choice for the best Cast Iron Skillet on the market. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore teaches Bridget how to make a show-stopping Chocolate Chip Skillet Cookie.

programme.title: Pork Tacos and Churros
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison prepares showstopping Citrus-Braised Pork Tacos. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a mild salsa taste test. Next, test cook Christie Morrison shows Julia how to make unforgettable So-Cal-inspired Churros. And finally, equipment expert Adam Ried shares his favorite piping set.

programme.title: A Trip to Tarheel Country
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof shows host Julia Collin Davison a top-secret recipe for North Carolina Dipped Fried Chicken. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of chocolate ice cream. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore makes Bridget a classic version of North Carolina Lemon Pie.

programme.title: Ultimate Comfort Foods
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster revive a traditional recipe for Wellesley Fudge Cake. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for immersion blenders. And finally, test cook Bryan Roof makes Bridget a Southern specialty, Chicken and Pastry.

programme.title: Kebabs and Rice
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison uncovers the secrets to making the best grilled shrimp and vegetable kebabs. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of whole-milk Greek yogurt. Finally, test cook Dan Souza shows Julia how to make Persian-style rice with a crispy, golden crust.

programme.title: Summer Pork Supper
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make the best Smoked Pork Loin with Dried-Fruit Chutney. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews the latest grill gadgets in the Equipment Corner. Finally, test cook Becky Hays shows Bridget how to make the ultimate Sweet Potato Soup.

programme.title: Diner-Style Favorites with a Twist
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster uncover the secrets to making the ultimate Italian-Style Turkey Meatballs. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews dry storage containers in the equipment corner. Next, science expert Dan Souza reveals the science behind kale's unique flavor. Finally, test cook Becky Hays makes Julia the perfect Kale Caesar Salad.

programme.title: Pad Thai and Panang Curry
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia prepare pad thai. Tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a tasting of coconut milk. Next, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews electric kettles. And finally, test cook Elle Simone makes panang beef curry.

programme.title: Better Breakfast
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster teach viewers how to make Easy Pancakes. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of turkey bacon. Next, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews syrup dispensers, and science expert Dan Souza demystifies the science of baking soda and browning. Then, test cook Becky Hays makes Julia a decadent version of a breakfast classic: Creamy French-Style Scrambled Eggs.

programme.title: Mexican Fare
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison prepare tacos dorados, and gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews a must-have for home cooks: fire extinguishers. Science expert Dan Souza then gives a demonstration of fast-freezing liquid nitrogen, and test cook Erin McMurrer makes roasted poblano and black bean enchiladas for Bridget.

programme.title: Backyard BBQ
programme.desc: On a hot summer's day, life doesn't get much better than a big, juicy, smoky slab of spicy, mouth-watering ribs. But more often than not, baby back ribs cooked at home come out tasting like dry shoe leather on a bone. Our goal was to produce flavorful, juicy, tender ribs that would be well worth the time, money, and effort.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - The Best of Dine & Dish Nation #1
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Pierre Binandeh, Tracie Ginster, and Marcel Sanders, who review signature dishes from the Grey Ghost Steakhouse and sumptuous soups and hearty sandwiches at the Russell Street Deli also Chris Guyor, Nailah Ellis-Brown and Niki Calme, who review sophisticated specialties at the Prime & Proper Steakhouse.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - King of Alaska
programme.desc: The mighty Yukon River is the longest river in Alaska and the third longest in North America. Its 2300‐mile stretch of pristine glacier‐fed waters holds the most legendary and mystical salmon in the world‐ the Yukon River King Salmon. In this episode, master seafood chef Rick Moonen ventures to this remote region to meet what he calls, “The best fish I ever ate.”

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Soy
programme.desc: Chef Staib prepares a Breaded Tofu Florentine, and a Tofu & Roasted Beet Salad.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: John Pence, Roger Kaplan, and Marty Blitz
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Sweetbreads with Balsamic Mustard Demi-glace, Pan-fried Soft-shell Crabs with Lobster Slaw, and Mojo Sabayon with Brazilnut-Phyllo Basket. Restaurants include: Westmoreland Bistro in Portland, City Grill in Atlanta, and Mise en Place in Tampa.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - Passing On The Wisdom
programme.desc: In this final episode, first they recreate a Mandarin classic dessert, glacéed bananas. Then Belinda does a b.patisserie signature favorite, her now famous chocolate banana almond croissant.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - The Tomato Whisperer
programme.desc: Chef Stellino explores the complexities of the tomato. Dishes include: Tomato Salad (Cherry tomatoes with mozzarella and onions) / Tonno alla Puttanesca (Tuna steaks with a special tomato sauce) / Blueberry Crumble.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Warm Up with Soup / Riscaldati con la Zuppa
programme.desc: Mary Ann celebrates the abundant seafood of Sardinia, including clams, squid, cod, and shrimp, when she prepares a Sardinian Style Fish Casserole that includes fregola, the distinctive pasta “pearls” that give this soup its hearty appeal. Plus a soup that’s simple as it is spectacular, Rice and Asparagus Soup.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - New Wave Chinese
programme.desc: Martin seeks out innovations in East/West cuisine in Honolulu with two chefs who have used their Chinese heritage to create modern masterpieces. This episode's recipes include: Duck-filled Sweet Sesame Balls, Char Siu Quesadillas, Roast Duck Nachos and Beer-Battered Ahi Rolls.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Fired Up, Down Under
programme.desc: Grilling doesn't get much more primal than lamb on a shovel, a specialty of the Australian Outback. G'day and good grilling.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Pesto Perfecto
programme.desc: Pesto is much more than basil and pine nuts. Learn the technique and make tomato pesto (with our infamous flowerpot chicken and bruschetta), walnut pesto and even your own pesto with the flavors you choose. Meet some olive growers who make olive oil in the Napa Valley.

programme.title: Lidia's Italian Table - Frico & Chicken Under A Brick
programme.desc: Lidia prepares Frico, a specialty of her native Friuli. Frico is a pancake made by sauteing Montasio cheese in a skillet until golden brown. Lidia shows us the basic dish, and then a creative surprise. Next, it’s Chicken under brick: a split chicken seared (under the weight of a brick, or heavy skillet) on the stove top until crisp-skinned, golden brown, and served immediately.

programme.title: Infusion - Burgers
programme.desc: Today, Infusion takes on the classic hamburger.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Beef
programme.desc: “There’s nothing as good as a good piece of meat”, and as Julia is quick to point out, there is less and less really good (well marbled and aged) beef to be found. Hangar Steak, Skirt Strip, Flank and Ribeye.

programme.title: Cucina Amore - Rice Balls with Four Cheeses
programme.desc: A Sicilian specialty, robust golden rice balls filled with cheese pasta topped with colorful vegetable ragú sauce and walnut cake spiced with honey-cinnamon syrup.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table - My Three Favorite Boys
programme.desc: This episode is all about Pati’s boys - it’s time for a little mother/son bonding. First, Pati takes Alan, Sami, and Juju to their favorite place to have fun, and then for lunch, the boys will pick their absolute favorite dishes that their mom makes. The only hitch? They have to give mom a hand as she prepares each dish.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - Passing On The Wisdom
programme.desc: In this final episode, first they recreate a Mandarin classic dessert, glacéed bananas. Then Belinda does a b.patisserie signature favorite, her now famous chocolate banana almond croissant.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - The Tomato Whisperer
programme.desc: Chef Stellino explores the complexities of the tomato. Dishes include: Tomato Salad (Cherry tomatoes with mozzarella and onions) / Tonno alla Puttanesca (Tuna steaks with a special tomato sauce) / Blueberry Crumble.

programme.title: This Weekend - Island Hopping in Flores, Indonesia
programme.desc: Roz Pho spends her adventurous weekend by sailing, snorkelling, cooking and witness the komodo dragons - all in Flores, Indonesia.

programme.title: This Weekend - Canyoning in Da Lat, Vietnam
programme.desc: This Weekend - Khai Saharom travels in style, canyons and cooks in Vietnam's 'best kept secret' the beautiful highlands of Da Lat.

programme.title: This Weekend - Biking in Mindoro, Philippines
programme.desc: Vaune Phan, heads to Mindoro, Philippines and experiences the local Mangyan culture, zip lines and witnesses how tuna is prepared for export

programme.title: This Weekend - Going Green in Chambok, Cambodia
programme.desc: his Weekend - Thanuja Ananthan, a model and activist takes off to Chambok Cambodia to explore village life filled with fun and adventure.

programme.title: This Weekend - River Surfing in Riau, Indonesia
programme.desc: Heng Su-Ann heads off to Pekanbaru, Indonesia, learning about batik bono and traditional fishing and river surfs on the legendary bono wave.

programme.title: This Weekend - Road Trip to Bentong, Malaysia
programme.desc: Claire Jedrek & Yuey Tan drive to Bentong, Malaysia for a fun-filled weekend getaway riding horses, ATVs and relaxing in a Japanese spa.

programme.title: This Weekend - Aerial Adventures in Cebu
programme.desc: In Cebu, Philippines, MMA fighter Theebaan challenges himself with aerial adventures. He confronts a lifelong fear to skydive.

programme.title: This Weekend - Speed Thrill in Perth
programme.desc: Munah Bagharaib, an online personality, chases thrills in Perth. She flies a chopper, rides a high-flying trapeze and races a formula 1 car.

programme.title: This Weekend - Sand and Sea Adventures in Mui Ne
programme.desc: Pro boxer Kirstie Gannaway finds surpreises in Mui Ne, Vietnam. She bashes through dunes in a truck, scarfs down a meal of lizard, and sails a catamaran.

programme.title: This Weekend - Island Adventures in Okinawa
programme.desc: Food writer Victoria Cheng experiences Okinawa, Japan, paragliding across the ocean and snorkeling the Blue Cave.

programme.title: This Weekend - Nature Adventure in Margaret River Region
programme.desc: Aaron Wong, a photographer and amateur chef, explores Margaret River Region, Australia. He dives Busselton Jetty and in a personal first, tries coasteering.

programme.title: This Weekend - Staycation Adventure in Singapore
programme.desc: Fiona Fussi staycates in Singapore, seeing her city in a different light. She climbs a ship's mast and jets skyward on a hydro blade.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Welcome to Mexico
programme.desc: In the first episode, Peter kicks off his adventure at the US border in the state of Chihuahua. He gets his first real taste of Tex Mex in the form of a burrito, before cooking a mouth-watering take on an old favourite - Chilli con Carne.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Fishing, Fun and Tacos
programme.desc: Having explored the beef territory of northern Mexico, it's time to head for some seafood as Peter Kuruvita descends 2000 metres by train to explore Mexico's Pacific coast - home of prawns, giant oysters and the original fish tacos.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - The Big Smoke
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in his first big Mexican city Guadalajara, where he will sample a classic slow cooked goat dish known as Birria, before heading to the iconic town of Tequila and going behind the scenes at a boutique distillery.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - The Real Mexico
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita gets to know the real Mexico, traveling to the ghost town of Real de Catorce in search of peyote, before heading south to the romantic town of Guanajuato to learn how to make the most ubiquitous of all Mexican food, tortillas.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Megacity
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in one of the largest metropolises on earth, Mexico City, discovering a city of extremes with high end dining sitting side by side with some of the cheapest and tastiest street food in the world.

programme.title: Ask TOH | EV Charger, New Sink
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner install an electric vehicle charger next to his house. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Then, Richard helps a homeowner install a new kitchen sink and faucet.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Thermostat, Solar
programme.desc: Roger teaches Kevin about lengths to consider when mowing the lawn. Richard travels to Pittsburgh to install a thermostat that interfaces with a smartphone to save energy and money. Ross Trethewey walks Kevin through the installation of a photovoltaic solar array on the barn. And Kevin, along with Tom, Richard and Roger ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | 35 Years of This Old House
programme.desc: In celebration of 35 years of This Old House, we look back at all that's changed in the last 35 years, and also what hasn't: our commitment to delivering trusted ideas and information to empower homeowners. This season begins in Boston's oldest neighborhood, Charlestown. Kevin and Norm highlight Charlestown's historical importance, from colonial times through WWII. Our new project is part of a cluster of 1850s-era Greek Revival houses tucked into the backside of Bunker Hill. Homeowner Angela Daigle shows Kevin the period feel and features of her home that she loves, but also the outdated kitchen and poor organization of space that she'd like to improve. Upstairs, Tom Silva shows Norm the spaces that will be getting minimal work: an existing guest room, guest bath, and living room. But one level up, on the third floor, it will likely be a full gut to give Angela a better master suite with additional living space, assuming the City approves the plan to enlarge the existing dormers. Out back, Roger shows Kevin the sad state of the crumbling retaining walls. Then Kevin finds Richard formulating a plan for the basement. Norm stops in next door to meet Maggie Boone to see how she recently addressed a lot of the same issues that Angela faces by renovating her own row house. And Norm and Tom test for lead paint before beginning demo on the first floor, as downstairs, Kevin, Richard and mason Mark McCullough start digging into the project.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Brick Rowhouse Blues
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Tom solving a major problem with the house: The exterior walls are bowing out from the weight of the roof over 160 years. His solution: build a structural wall inbound of the brick, lash the brick to the structure with threaded rods and epoxy, and then parge the whole thing. In the basement, news is brighter: Richard shows Kevin the result of two weeks of hand digging and a week of rough plumbing. The floor is down several inches, the sewer line tucked neatly in the floor, and the radiant heat/insulation system is currently going in. On the third floor, Norm shows Kevin how the roof has been under-structured since it was originally built. The structure they added in the 1980s helped, but it still needs more. Tom joins to get the first of two massive LVLs tucked into the pockets in the brick sidewalls, and fastened in place. To see how it's holding up, Norm revisits the townhouse we renovated in Charlestown 14 years ago. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin how he's going to open up the back wall for the new bump out. It starts with using two temporary steel "needles" through the reinforced rear wall to hold the weight of the house while a new steel beam is inserted. Then, the bricks can come down one by one to make a small new addition for the breakfast area.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Bridge to Charlestown
programme.desc: Richard gets up close and personal with one of Charlestown's most iconic structures-the Zakim Bridge-by talking with the structural engineer on the project, Ted Zoli. At the project house, Kevin finds the front of the building obscured by scaffolding it will be used to replace the failing asphalt roof, and also to build the dormer, if approval comes in from the City. Inside, Tom shows Kevin how he'll have to modify the old chimney for the new gas fireplace units, and they see the framing progress, including the new bump out for the breakfast area. The third floor master suite is all framed up, save the dormer, which is still in regulatory limbo. In the backyard, mason Mark McCullough presents options for rebuilding the decaying retaining walls at different price points. Then, they dig into the demolition, carrying all of the old wall material out through the house, by hand. Norm visits a salvage yard in Boston's South End that has dozens of architectural elements from the Greek Revival period, including a marble mantel and some glass doorknobs that are perfect for Angela's house. Several days later, Mark starts installing the homeowner's choice for the retaining wall: an interlocking concrete system with a bluestone cap. Richard shows Kevin the progress on the rough plumbing and electrical, including a high velocity mini duct system that will pair with an electric inverter heat pump unit to supply either air handlers or high wall cassette units. It's an efficient and quiet solution, which is perfect for this close-knit City location.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Wood and Water
programme.desc: Richard stops by the Charlestown Navy Yard to see a very special guest arrive: the last wooden whaling ship in the world, the Charles W. Morgan, which was built c.1840, just a decade before our project house. At the jobsite, Norm finds architect Sally DeGan, who shares the good news that after months of work and waiting, our new dormer was finally approved. Up at the roofline, Tom shows Norm the progress on the dormer, and how he's carefully waterproofing its low slope roof. Inside, Kevin notes progress: insulation went in a few days ago and wallboard is going up. Out back, to tie in the new work with the old house, mason Mark McCullough installs a reclaimed brick veneer on the new kitchen bump out. Kevin drops in to see kitchen designer Kathy Marshall at her studio in Wenham, Massachusetts, where she is working on the interior design details with homeowner Angela Daigle. For a more authentic look, Norm and Tom replace the fake, applied vinyl shutters on our house with authentic, operable shutters make out of durable fiberglass and PVC.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Gardens and Greek Revival
programme.desc: Roger visits the Sullivan Square Community Garden, while Richard works with fireplace expert John Sullivan to rough in the ductwork for the new direct vent gas fireplace units. With plaster work and flooring completed, Norm and Tom add some subtle Greek Revival details to the interior window trim package. For inspiration for her own urban garden, Roger takes homeowner Angela Daigle to see some the hidden gardens of Beacon Hill. Painting contractor Mauro Henrique paints the exterior window trim on our rowhouse, and puts up samples of a few bold color choices for the new front door

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Kitchens and Baths
programme.desc: Kevin finds Tom getting ready for a major upgrade to the front of the house: a new four-panel front door with glass transom and sidelights in traditional Greek Revival style. Inside, Kevin and Tom recall some of their favorite TOH kitchens over the years before seeing another one in progress Angela's cabinets have arrived from Pennsylvania. On the second floor, Tom and Kevin install new wood wainscoting to replace the worn out, poorly made version that used to be there. Norm learns about Charlestown's ancient past from city archaeologist Joe Bagley, who provides a rare look at his warehouse of artifacts in storage and testing at Boston's own archaeology lab. Tile contractor Mark Ferrante uses a marble basket weave tile from an online supplier to make a feature wall insert in the master shower. At the back addition, Kevin and Tom install a small section of copper roof to add a bit of character and long-term durability to the small roof

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Rowhouse, Lighthouse
programme.desc: Tom builds a hidden door to the basement by concealing it behind a system of rails and stiles that look like paneling. Marble specialist Danny Puccio shows Kevin the new Carrara marble island top and how they made the delicate ogee edge detail back at the shop. Angela gives Roger the news that despite a beautiful new design for her backyard, her budget is beyond stretched and she'll have to hold off on planting until next year. Fence contractor Mark Bushway installs a new PVC fence on top of the retaining wall to provide some privacy for the backyard. Richard heads out on the water to see how one intrepid homeowner is turning one of Boston's iconic lighthouses into his family's summer home. Norm and Tom restore the old, weather beaten exterior front steps with a grinder, a router, some epoxy, and a non-slip exterior paint. Stone specialist Steve Torok installs the salvaged marble mantel and surround in the sitting room

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Rowhouse Reimagined
programme.desc: After five months of work in Charlestown, the exterior is nicely restored thanks to a new dormer, windows, shutters, and front entry. Inside, Kevin finds systems integrator Greg Smizer test-driving the new internet-based security system, wireless music system and remote controlled window shades with solar battery back up. Norm meets closet designer Brian McSharry to see the pros and cons of designing a closet around a window. Richard shows Angela the basics of cooking with induction technology: her new cooktop relies on a magnetic field to generate heat within the pots and pans, instead of a traditional heating element. Norm meets up with Richard in the partially unfinished basement to see the mechanical room, where the systems integrate to provide comfort for the whole house. Kevin checks out Angela's new outdoor kitchen: powder coated stainless steel cabinets, a gas grill, and soapstone countertops. On the third floor, Kevin finds Angela and her mission accomplished: a serene master suite retreat where she can rest and relax. On the second floor, interior designer Kathy Marshall shows Norm the changes to the guest room, guest bath and bold new living room painted cranberry red, even on the ceiling. Downstairs, Kathy joins Angela and Kevin to see the former dining room transformed into a sophisticated sitting room, and all of the details of the new kitchen: cabinetry, tile, storage, a splashy new powder room, and the window seat addition that was worth all of the hard work

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Roots
programme.desc: This Old House kicks off the second project of their 35th Anniversary Season: an addition to a 1966 Colonial Revival in historic Lexington, Mass. With a history that extends back to the time of the American Revolution, Lexington is home to a strong tradition of Colonial-style homes that are still popular today. Homeowners Jeremy and Jody Kieval love the neighborhood but not necessarily the tall trees that hide the front of their house they'd like a curb appeal makeover that includes more sunlight and a big new farmer's porch. Inside, the front hall and dining room are working well, but the overflowing playroom needs to be relocated. Jeremy loves to cook and wants his dream kitchen to become the new heart of the home, so the nearly 50-year-old kitchen will be gutted and redesigned. Jody laments the lack of mudroom and access to the garage-but all of that will be taken care of by the new addition. All of the new upstairs space goes to the girls: the plan is to add two more bedrooms, a laundry room, and a sitting area over the garage. Norm meets architect Bill Hubner to discuss the features of the existing house, and how he's incorporated them into a plan for a sympathetic addition. In the 1980s-era great room, Richard explains why the tall room is hard to heat despite the best efforts of the baseboard and electric heat. Downstairs, the lack of insulation needs to be addressed and the heating and cooling systems may not be sized to support all of the new work in the addition. Roger shows Kevin the small stream in the backyard and the lengths that we're going go through to protect it during construction.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Footings and Foundations
programme.desc: Kevin discusses This Old House's history renovating Colonials and Colonial Revivals. The Lexington homeowners want to stay in their house during the renovation, so Tom shows Kevin how he's going to demo in phases, keeping the kitchen intact for as long as possible. Today, they'll do exterior demo only, starting with the back porch. Kevin visits a concrete shop in Amesbury, Massachusetts, to see them make the prefabricated concrete footings needed for our job. Norm explains the framing of the first floor platform from underneath, then climbs up on top to see how Tom is building the rear gable wall of the addition lying down: they sheath it, add the cellular PVC rake boards, and then stand the wall up. Roger gets underway with the layout and excavation for the new footings for the first floor addition. The new prefab footings are unloaded into the backyard, set, leveled and plumbed. Tom leaves them exposed so the inspector can sign off before back filling. Kevin explains the building permit process and the role of the building commissioner, Fred Lonardo, as he comes in to make his first inspection on the footings.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Curb Appeal
programme.desc: At the Lexington project, Kevin finds the front gable wall of the second floor up, and the roof framing underway. Around back, Tom installs a 24-foot long LVL to temporarily hold up the second floor while he adds new structure. Then, they frame the rest of the addition roof. Nearby in Lexington's historic district, architect Frank Shirley shows Norm how people have been using front porches to lend character and charm to Colonial style homes for hundreds of years. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin the framing of our new farmer's porch and then they build a small overhang to extend the look across the garage. Inside, Kevin sees how the homeowners are getting by without a kitchen, which has been gutted and is ready to be expanded thanks to a 24-foot steel beam that will carry the weight of the second floor. Later, Tom presents a solution to the ceiling height challenge in the old part of the kitchen: a structural ceiling that will allow him to gain some height over the islands, while allowing for both adequate structure, and a clever chase for wiring.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Smart Solutions
programme.desc: Norm visits the Hancock-Clarke house to see where Paul Revere stopped to warn John Hancock and Samuel Adams of the advancing British troops during the start of the American Revolution. Kevin recaps how the roofers applied new architectural shingles to tie the old house in with the new addition. Tom shows Kevin the progress on the new back deck, and how the architect has called for a corner stair leading down to the backyard. The framing requires two sets of traditional stringer systems, joined in the middle by a hip stringer and a series of jack stringers the same idea as framing a hip roof. Kevin finds Richard and plumbing contractor Kevin Bilo fighting to keep the P-trap from the new bathtub on the second floor from interfering with the decorative ceiling of the new kitchen. They use a new German bath waste and overflow kit that allows for the flexibility needed to solve the problem. Kevin and Norm finish up the trim and decking on the new corner deck stair. For the ipe deckboards that are sharply mitered in the corner, Norm has settled on using a floating tenon connection to prevent them from opening up over time

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Making Connections
programme.desc: Roger meets landscape designer Tim Lee to see how the small stream in the backyard affects all other areas of the yard, including a patch of grass that has to be returned to the wild, and a stand of trees out front that can now be removed after careful consideration by the Conservation Commission. Before the trees come down, Roger shows Kevin the valuable shade plants that could be damaged in the process, so they're relocated to a new bed in the side yard to provide screening from the neighboring house. Tom and Kevin cut away a five-foot section of wall to connect the new kitchen to the old great room. Richard shows Kevin two common rough plumbing conditions in the kitchen: a main sink that has a traditional drain and vent configuration, and an island prep sink, which requires a bow vent in order to work properly. Kevin meets building inspector Fred Lonardo to learn how a GC can call for a "partial framing inspection" to keep progress moving on a job, as in the case with our front porch. Arborist John Marquis shows Roger the proper preparation, safety precautions, and procedures for doing a "take down" of the 12 trees in the front yard.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Exterior Details
programme.desc: Tom shows Kevin the new mudroom door and the work required to patch in new clapboards to match the old around it. Inside, two weeks of rough electrical is coming to a close as the subs call for their inspection. Kevin meets electrician Allen Gallant and inspector Alix Berube to see what goes into a rough electrical inspection. At the back deck, Tom shows Kevin how he's using a hybrid railing system that has cedar posts and railing caps, with stainless steel cable "balusters". Kevin visits kitchen designer Donna Venegas at her showroom at Boston's Design Center to see the neutrals, textures, and metallics that are currently trending in kitchens. Then, project designer Michele Kelly and homeowner Jeremy Kieval show Kevin the layout and design choices for the new family kitchen. With a house from 1966, almost anything goes, so paint color expert Bonnie Krims gives Kevin and homeowner Jody Kieval a range of options for the exterior colors

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Inspections
programme.desc: Norm and Tom install reinforced fiberglass columns to support the new farmer's porch. Richard meets plumbing contractor Brian Bilo and local plumbing inspector Donald "Duke" LaConte to see what he's looking for at our rough plumbing inspection. Kevin and Tom meet building commissioner Fred Lonardo to see what goes into the rough mechanical and rough framing inspections. After Fred signs off, insulation begins. Tom shows Kevin the storm window system he's using to enclose the screen porch, and Russell Parrot shows how we're going to heat the space: with electric radiant floor heat. Norm and Tom welcome back Fred Lonardo to review the various ways we can achieve the insulation value we need in our walls to meet code.

programme.title: Sell This House!: Jersey City, NJ
programme.desc: Arthur and Katie are ready to retire and move on to a home in Arizona. They have had their two bedroom townhome on the market for over six months with no interest what so ever. The place is boring and very outdated. Buyers are turned off and don't even remember going through the house. Designer and staging expert Roger Hazard helps Arthur and Katie do a total home staging makeover. Roger removes over half their furniture and sends it off to storage. Painting the bland white walls with a new coat of paint along with a dark accent wall makes the place contemporary and a stand-out for buyers. Roger had our homeowners do several projects including artwork for the dining room wall. Their home sold the day after we left! And, as part of the deal, the buyers wanted Arthur and Katie's Masterpiece included.
